div.l: For euery clerke helde with other
They seide the man was wode my lefe brother
And euery man gan to laughe at this stryf
This was swyfed the carpenters wyf
For all his kepyng and his Ielousye
And absalon hath kyste hir nether Eye
And nycholas is scalded in the toute
This tale is done god saue all the route
¶ Here Endeth the mylners tale

and
begynneth the prologe of the Reve
¶ Prologus Reve
When folkes hadde laghen of this nyce caas
Of absalon and hende nycholas
Dyủers folkes dyuersly they seide
But for the moste party they loghe and pleide
Ne at this tale I sawe no man hym greue
But it were oonly Oswolde the reue
Be cause he was of carpenters crafte
A litell Ire in his herte is lefte
He gan to grugge and blame it a lite
So thek qduod he full wele I couthe the quyte
With bleryng of a proude mylners Eye
If that me liste to speke of rybawdrye
But yk · am olde me liste not play for age
Gras tyme is done my foder is now forage
My white toppe writeth myn olde yeres
Myn is as mouled as myn heeres
And yite I fare as dothe an open ers
That ilke frothe is leng̉er the wers
Till it be rote in mulloke or in stre
We olde men I drede so fare we
Till we be roten can we nought be rype
We hopen all day whiles the worlde wil pipe
For in oure will there sticketh eủer a nayle
To haue an hore hede and a grene tayle
As hath a leke for though oure myrthe be done
Oure will desireth folye eủer anoone
For when we may nought done then wil we speken̄
